result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandan J C Berard

records.addlTxt: filed by Brandan J C Berard
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
9:34 AM Defendant Brandan J C Berard in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defendant confirms he is unrepresented at this time, but wishes to be represented at this time. 

Court advises Defendant of ability to apply at the PD's office, and advises that he must be denied for PD representation in order to qualify for a court appointed attorney. 

Defendant states that he recently lost his job, and may qualify for a Public Defender. 
Defendant to go to PD's office after court today to apply for representation. 
Court will set hearing in 30 days.
Hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A/Victim B/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

8:47 AM Defendant Brandan J C Berard in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Motion Order to Seal Victim Identification Key, Signed by Judge Carter on 09/12/2022
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
